articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike on a vehicle in the occupied West Bank killed a commander in the Palestinian armed group Hamas on Saturday, Hamas media reported, while Palestinian news agency WAFA said four other men were also killed.
articles.title: Israeli airstrike kills 5 in West Bank, including Hamas commander - Palestinian media

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines and Germany have committed to concluding a broader defence cooperation arrangement, their defence ministers said in a joint statement on Sunday.
articles.title: Philippines, Germany commit to concluding broader defence agreement

articles.author: Stephanie Kelly, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden expressed hope Iran would stand down despite its threat to avenge the assassination of Hamas’ leader in Tehran, as fears mounted that Israel’s war against Palestinian militants in Gaza could escalate into a wider Middle East conflict.
articles.title: Biden voices hope Iran will stand down but is uncertain

articles.author: Hollie Adams
articles.description: British police are putting more officers on the streets amid warnings of more violent disorder this weekend and mosques have tightened security after anti-immigration protesters torched cars following the murder of three young girls.
articles.title: British police boost presence after night of rioting in Sunderland

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has revoked a plea deal agreed to earlier this week with the man accused of masterminding the Sept. 11 attacks, Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, and two of his accomplices, according to a memorandum signed by Austin on Friday.
articles.title: Pentagon chief revokes plea deal with three Sept. 11 suspects

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas' slain leader Ismail Haniyeh was killed in Tehran by a short-range projectile with a warhead of about 7 kg, Iran's Revolutionary Guards said in a statement on Saturday.
articles.title: Iran says Hamas leader Haniyeh was killed by 'short-range projectile'

articles.author: Mircely Guanipa, Vivian Sequera
articles.description: The Organization of American States on Saturday urged peace in Venezuela ahead of separate marches to support the government and the country's political opposition amid spiraling tensions connected to contested election results.
articles.title: Venezuela election marches must be peaceful, says OAS body

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A U.N. commission of inquiry said in March that it had documented credible allegations of executions of at least 32 Ukrainian POWs in 12 incidents from December 2023 to February,
articles.title: Ukraine accuses Russian forces of killing, dismembering prisoner-of-war

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: Heavy rains have pummeled the North's northwestern areas, flooding more than 4,000 homes and isolating some 5,000 residents
articles.title: North Korea says Russia's Putin offered humanitarian aid over flood damage

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: Supporters of jailed Belarusian Nobel Peace laureate Ales Bialiatski say the human rights activist should have been included in the biggest East-West prisoner swap since the Cold War on Thursday.
articles.title: Jailed Belarus Nobel winner should have been freed in prisoner swap, say supporters
